data.title: Quaint, Cozy and romantic little restaurant!
data.text: Went to Cafe Europa after a day at the Nauticus Museum with my husband, six month old baby and parents and had a great time! Loved the ambiance of this place! It's cozy and quaint! The decor and dim lighting makes you feel like if you were at a nice cafe in Paris.  The service was absolutely superb! I was a little worried that we walked in without a reservation but we had no issues! The staff is friendly and extremely attentive! The food was delicious and the bar is well stocked! My dad ordered Chivas, which most places usually don't have, but they had it! The prices are very reasonable for the type of food  and the type of restaurant that Cafe Europa is! The owner of the place is absolutely delightful! Truly a gem of a restaurant!

data.title: Rehearsal Dinner
data.text: Cafe Europa graciously hosted the rehearsal dinner before our son's wedding.  The atmosphere, waitstaff, hosts, and especially the food were outstanding.  Everything and everyone was refined, elegant, and top notch.

data.title: Perfect Meal
data.text: Highly re I mend this restaurant. Superior service, excellent food. Delicious lamb. Beautiful setting. Romantic. Great deserts. Not in the best area, but worth it for the European service and style.

data.title: Great owners
data.text: The food and customer service were amazing. The owners took great care to create an excellent menu. We're looking forward to returning.

data.title: One of our favorite Restaurants
data.text: When traveling through Portsmouth by car or boat we always make time to eat here. This restaurant has a continental flavor and Jon Paul makes dining a true pleasure.

data.title: So So
data.text: Eat at this restaurant basses on reviews. Service was excellent but I feel like the food was off - poor seasoning taste very bla!!. Only 3 table filed in the time I was there. Not the best!!

data.title: Judge
data.text: Excellent food and service. Small but adequate and filling portions. Large menu of daily fresh cooked items. On-street parking and nearby  parking garage.

data.title: Great food and service!
data.text: Each course of my meal was very tasty. My first time there, and they did not disappoint! Loved the "old world" atmosphere.

data.title: Great atmosphere and food
data.text: We tried this restaurant on the advice of a friend and were not disappointed. The décor is brick and wood with many interesting pieces of artwork on the walls. The "drinks person" who is a sommelier recommended a great wine. The food was delicious as was the desserts and coffee. The only reason I have not given a "5" was due to the slow service. The server assigned to us also had a large table, but other staff members finally pitched in and got our evening started with drinks and appetizer. The total meal took 2 1/2 hours, and although we were not in a hurry, I hope that this is not the normal duration for a meal. The only other suggestion is to offer a wine selection that has a few more decent options on a lower ($25) end since they all, as I remember, around $40 or more.

data.title: Regrets -- I hit an off night
data.text: Private dining on a weeknight.   I was the only diner.  What a shame to read about  one of the best places in Portsmouth and see it so underutilized. I suspect I know why.  I ordered the special of yellowfin tuna and requested medium rare.  It came to the table dry and overcooked – well done.  The sauce Provencal was spicy hot, drowning in capers – not like anything I had ever been served while dining in France.    I’ve eaten at the Europe  before and it was exceptional – Somethings change over time -- I probably won’t go here again.

data.title: Without equal
data.text: There are many good restaurants in Hampton Roads, Cafe Europa is considered among the best. For good reason. The food is superb, as is the service and the ambiance. With nightly special offerings, a surprise awaits with every visit. Our meals were deliciously memorable. The Tomato Bisque with crab meat was almost sinful it was so good!

data.title: Quiet sophistication
data.text: Ambiance and food here would be five stars in any major city. New York, D.C. New Orleans, San Francisco

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: We had never been her but my husband surprised me for a date night.  Wow, this is a beautiful, classy place.  Felt just like we were back in Europe. We started with a soup with leeks which was amazing!  My bowl was way too small..... Excellent.  I had their scallop dish which was superb and. My husband had a pork dish which was also awesome.  Will go back,

data.title: The reason to go to Portsmouth
data.text: Great food, nice people and the largest dessert selection I can remember. One of the few places that will make go back to Portsmouth.

data.title: Back again
data.text:
Cafe Europa has been a favorite for many years. The food is innovative and excellent and the restaurant has an old world ambiance you usually only find in Europe.
The owners and staff are extremely friendly. It is definitely worthwhile to take the trip through the tunnel if you live in Norfolk, Virginia Beach and Chesapeake.
To make the trip even more special, take the paddle wheeler to Portsmouth and walk to the restaurant. Beautiful scenery in the evening.

data.title: The Best Restaurant in the Area
data.text:
Award winning European food, in a romantic very setting.  This is my favorite restaurant in Virginia.  I try not to use it only for special occasions but can't always get back to town.

From lunch to dinner, there is no rush as the food is prepared fresh daily to your liking by course.  The cost is very reasonable I think for the quality with smaller portions as most restaurants seems to serve huge portions as the residents prefer it seemed to me.  Cafe Europa was more in line with what I was used to eating.

data.title: Favorite in Hampton Roads
data.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the Hampton Roads area.   The chef and his wife are the owners and provide a wonderful European dining experience. The food is delicious and service is excellent.   We have been dining here for years and it is always a treat.

data.title: Definitely lives up to "#1 in Hampton Rhodes"!  WONDERFUL dining experience.
data.text: Four of us wandered into this little gem on a whim -- we were at a conference.  Two of us had the fish special on the menu and two of us had the steak frites.  I expected a 5-6 oz steak, but what I got instead was a HUGE portion of deliciousness!  It was cooked perfectly (I ordered it rare) and you could almost cut it with a fork.  I had a seafood soup as an appetizer.  We had two wines, red and white, on recommendation of one of our waiters -- both excellent.  I would highly recommend this restaurant -- but be prepared for the price, with tip it was almost $90/each -- but WELL worth it!

data.title: Old World Charm
data.text:
Café Europa is in a class all of its own! Elegant and charming without being stuffy! We started with soup, followed by lobster ravioli for myself and scallops Provençal for my husband, complemented by a crisp French white. We also had salads and desserts. 
The meal and evening was a great success.

data.title: Worth the dinning experience
data.text: We tried the cafe Europa on a friend's recommendation. We were not disappointed.  We started with an appetizer of escargot. It was prepared differently then I have ever tried. It is a must. I enjoyed the salmon and my wife had lobster raviolis. The atmosphere is elegant, great for a upscale dinner with friends or as a couple. The menu is not overpriced. I will be returning
